file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 35-20-18-04 - GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the gaseous oxygen cylinder. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - RE- ALL 35-20-18-000-801-A MOVAL GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - INSTAL- ALL 35-20-18-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 35-20-18 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-20-18-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the gaseous oxygen cylinder. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) Commercially available Safety ring 1/LU F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Dispensing unit installed in the lavatory. H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Open these circuit breakers: • PASS OXY DEPLOY 1 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/MISCELLANEOUS). • PASS OXY DEPLOY 2 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING: • ALWAYS BE CAREFUL NOT TO ACCIDENTALLY PULL THE LANYARDS OR FIRING PIN OF A GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER NOT USED. THE REMOVAL OF THE FIRING PIN FROM THE GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER CAUSES THE FLOW OF OXYGEN TO START AND YOU CANNOT STOP IT UNTIL THE GENERATOR IS EMPTY. • DO NOT USE OIL OR OTHER PETROLEUM-BASE LUBRICANTS ON THE OXYGEN EQUIPMENT. THIS CAN CAUSE DANGEROUS FIRE AND BAD INJURY TO PERSONS. • KEEP ALL SOURCES OF IGNITION (HOT EXHAUST, SPARKS, FLAMES, SMOKE) AWAY FROM THE OXYGEN SERVICING AREA. • PUT A SAFETY PIN IN THE ACTUATOR HOLE. NOTE: Prepare a clean area and work surface before you start the maintenance practices. (1) Get access to the gaseous oxygen cylinder (1) through the doors (2) of the oxygen dispensing unit (5). NOTE: Do not let that the oxygen mask falls down. If it occurs, the gaseous oxygen cylinder starts and will not stop until it is empty. (2) Lock the activation of the gaseous oxygen cylinder as follows: (a) Install a safety pin in the actuator hole. Refer to DET. B, Figure 401. (3) Disconnect the oxygen cylinder lanyard loops from the passenger-mask-assembly snap hook (4). The snap hook (4) stays with the passenger mask assemblies (6). NOTE: Do not disconnect the lanyards (9) from the firing pin connection (8) on the gaseous oxygen cylinder (1). (4) Loosen the oxygen cylinder clamp screw until the clamp (7) is fully open and the oxygen cylinder (1) can be removed. (5) Remove from the oxygen cylinder (1) the oxygen supply tubes (3) that supply the passenger mask assembly. (6) Carefully remove oxygen cylinder (1) from the oxygen dispensing units (5). NOTE: Be careful not to tangle the oxygen supply tubes (3) or the cylinder lanyards (9). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: POST-MOD SB 145-35-0008 Gaseous Oxygen Cylinder - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONES 261 262 A 4. LANYARD 3. SUPPLY SNAP HOOK OXYGEN TUBES 5. OXYGEN DISPENSING 2. MALE UNIT DOOR 6. PASSENGER MASK ASSEMBLY B 1. GASEOUS OXYGEN 7. CLAMP CYLINDER 2. FEMALE IDENTIFICATION DOOR LABEL (REF.) DET. A TYPICAL SAFETY PLUG INDICATOR CAP (GREEN) 3. SUPPLY OXYGEN TUBES 1 8. FIRING PIN 2 SAFETY PIN (REF.) ACTUATOR HOLE (REF.) 9. LANYARDS DET. B 1 MAKE SURE THAT ALL GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER LOCKING DEVICES ARE REMOVED AFTER THE INSTALLATION OF THE GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER. DO NOT REMOVE THE FIRING PIN. MAKE SURE THAT THE FIRING PIN IS CORRECTLY INSTALLED BEFORE YOU REMOVE THE SAFETY PIN. 2 REMOVE THE SAFETY PIN AFTER THE INSTALLATION AND PUT IT BACK IN PLACE AFTER THE REMOVAL. EM145AMM350446A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 35-20-18-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the gaseous oxygen cylinder. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION TASK 35-20-01-860-801-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Dispensing unit installed in the lavatory. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: • ON ITS INSTALLATION, MAKE SURE THAT DEVICES AGAINST ACCIDENTAL PULL ARE REMOVED FROM THE GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER NOT TO PREVENT OPERATION. ONLY THE FIRING PIN MUST STAY IN THE ACTUATOR. • DO NOT CUT THE ACTUATOR SAFETY PIN. • ALWAYS BE CAREFUL NOT TO ACCIDENTALLY PULL THE LANYARDS OR FIRING PIN OF A GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER NOT USED. THE REMOVAL OF THE FIRING PIN FROM THE GASEOUS OXYGEN CYLINDER CAUSES THE FLOW OF OXYGEN TO START AND YOU CANNOT STOP IT UNTIL THE GENERATOR IS EMPTY. • DO NOT USE OIL AND OTHER PETROLEUM-BASE LUBRICANTS ON THE OXYGEN EQUIPMENT. THIS CAN CAUSE DANGEROUS FIRE AND BAD INJURY TO PERSONS. • KEEP ALL SOURCES OF IGNITION (HOT EXHAUST, SPARKS, FLAMES, SMOKE) AWAY FROM THE OXYGEN SERVICING AREA. NOTE: Prepare a clean area and work surface before you start the maintenance practices. NOTE: For the lavatory, do the gaseous oxygen cylinder installation procedure as follows: (1) Put the oxygen cylinder (1) into the cylinder cavity in the box assembly. (2) Turn the oxygen cylinder (1) until the identification nameplate of the cylinder points towards the door assemblies when they are closed (approximately 45ÃÂ°). Make sure that the firing pin ring points towards the same angle. (3) Close and attach the oxygen cylinder clamp (7). (4) Install to the oxygen cylinder (1) the oxygen supply tubes (3) that supply the passenger mask assembly. (5) Connect the oxygen-generator lanyard loops to the passenger-mask-assembly snap hook (4). (6) After you install the oxygen cylinder, do as follows: (a) Remove the safety pin in the actuator hole. Refer to DET. B, (Figure 401). (7) Stow the mask. Refer to TASK 35-20-01-860-801-A. (8) Close the doors (2) of the oxygen dispensing unit (5). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close these circuit breakers: • PASS OXY DEPLOY 1 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 1/MISCELLANEOUS). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL • PASS OXY DEPLOY 2 (location tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 35-20-18 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
